snippet.title: gyro​Voice: Advertising Lessons From The Rolling Stones
snippet.description: Keith Richards is one of history’s most riotous rockers. Having amassed monumental success spanning five decades by staying true to himself and his art, there are (of course) a few pearls of wisdom we can glean as an agency. Keith may be idolised by many, but he wouldn’t be held in [...] read »

snippet.title: Back To the Stone Age? New Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer Bans Working From Home
snippet.description: Yahoo rankles employees and supporters of workplace flexibility with a new ban on working from home.

snippet.title: Want An Original Ronnie Wood Rolling Stones Tour Outfit In Time For 50th Anniversary Concert? They're Up For Sale

snippet.title: Amazon Wins In Online Customer Service, Netflix Sinks Like A Stone
snippet.description: ForeSee Results’ e-retail satisfaction index ranks Amazon tops, Netflix in the middle, and Gap and Overstock at the bottom in online customer service. read »

snippet.title: 5 Perks Worth Negotiating at Work
snippet.description: Whether or not it's explicitly said, many things at your office may not be set in stone. Find out what's up for discussion. read »

snippet.title: Satisfaction Guaranteed
snippet.description: After landing a $70 million guarantee, the Stones have found that maybe you can always get what you want. read »

snippet.title: Rock And Roll, Russian Gangsters & Rising From The Dead: The Saga Of Electro-Harmonix
snippet.description: The entrepreneurial spirit is like an unrestrainable beast that’s quivers beneath the skin of some folks. As Mr. Hyde was just a tantrum away from taking over the mannerly Dr. Jekyll, the inner entrepreneur has only to smell an opportunity for profit or market share before convulsing to the surface. [...]

snippet.title: That Beatles Moment on 'Mad Men' Cost a Cool Quarter Million
snippet.description: The fifth season of "Mad Men" was delayed by a contract standoff between creator Matt Weiner, Lionsgate studio and the AMC cable network, a dispute that reportedly revolved around Weiner's belief that the other parties were trying to nickel-and-dime him. You couldn't have guessed that from Sunday night's episode, which prominently featured the [...] read »

snippet.title: Is Apple Losing Its Brand Equity?
snippet.description: The foundation of Apple’s brand equity is its promise to deliver a delightful user experience to consumers. Less than stellar consumer reviews on a number of applications from MobileMe to Apple Maps have nicked away at that promise. As the stock price and recent analyst price-target drops would lead us [...] read »
